webp

Class WebpParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • common.AbstractImageParser
      • webp.WebpParser

  • public class WebpParser
extends AbstractImageParser
    This program aims to read WebP image files and retrieve data structured in a series of RIFF-based chunks. For metadata access, only the EXIF chunk, if present, will be processed. At this stage, XMP metadata is considered for inclusion in this class on a later date.

    WebP Data Stream

    The WebP file format is built on the RIFF container, beginning with a fixed signature: 

     RIFF + FileSize (4 bytes) + WEBP

    This is followed by a sequence of chunks. Each chunk includes:

    • 4 bytes: Chunk FourCC (ASCII, for example: VP8 , VP8X, EXIF)
    • 4 bytes: Chunk payload size (unsigned, little-endian)
    • Payload: Variable-length data
    • Padding: If size is odd, 1 padding byte follows (not counted in the size field)

    There are both mandatory and optional chunk types.

    Core Chunk Types

    • VP8 – Lossy bitstream (standard)
    • VP8L – Lossless bitstream
    • VP8X – Extended format chunk (required for metadata and animation)

    Optional Chunk Types

    • EXIF – Embedded EXIF metadata
    • ICCP – Embedded ICC color profile
    • XMP – XMP metadata
    • ANIM / ANMF – Animation control and frames

    Chunk Processing

    • Only chunks specified in the requiredChunks list are read
    • An empty requiredChunks list disables chunk extraction
    • A null list results in all chunks being extracted

    When the EXIF chunk is found, its payload is parsed as TIFF/EXIF-formatted metadata. This is commonly used to extract orientation, date, and camera information.

    Since:
    13 August 2025
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Trevor Maggs
    See Also:
    WebP RIFF Container Specification
